intro: Matucana yanganucensis, commonly known as the Yanganucensis cycad, is a rare and ancient plant species native to the humid lowland forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Cycadaceae family and is characterized by its stout, unbranched trunk and dense, feather-like leaves. The plant produces cones, with male and female cones typically appearing on separate plants, a feature common in cycads. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native region. Its botanical study provides valuable insights into the evolution of cycads and their ecological roles in tropical ecosystems.
